title: Four arrested after Ada robbery updated
content: crime-scene-tape-png-2122026-ver1-0.png    Ada, Oklahoma —    Four people are behind bars following a robbery in Ada.    At about 11:20 A.M. on Friday Pontotoc County 911 Dispatchers received a call about two men who had been just held up at Natural Nails, which is located in the North Hills shopping center. The men were doing work inside of the salon which is currently closed for renovations.    The victims said two men came in the back door and held a knife to each of their throats and robbed them of their valuables.    Both of the victims identified one of the men as “Chino” he in fact was a day laborer they had hired at the salon during the past couple of days. The other man they did not know and he had his face covered. “Chino” was later identified as Banetana Pyashaway Moore a 28 year old Ada resident.    Ada Detectives started their work looking for Moore along with the other suspect and a few hours later they were able to track Moore down at the Quality Inn.    The Detectives along with Pontotoc County Deputies made a house call on one of the rooms and took Moore into custody along with three other people who were in the room. They picked up Belinda Smith, Aaron Owens and Stephanie Caltron, they are cooling their heels in the Pontotoc county jail while the DA determines what charges everyone will receive.
